byline.contributor: Paula Moura contributed reporting from Brasília and São Paulo.

abstract: Brazilian National Congress is set to vote on whether to begin impeachment proceedings against Pres Dilma Rousseff in divided country; reports of fights, harassment and shattered relationships among Brazilians of all ages are increasing as political warfare escalates.

headline.print_headline: Leader’s Fate Strains the Ties Binding Brazil
headline.main: Fight to Impeach Brazil’s Leader Tears at Fabric of Daily Life

snippet: Brazilian politics is a blood sport in the best of times, but the battle over whether to impeach President Dilma Rousseff is inflaming passions as never before.
lead_paragraph: Brazilian politics is a blood sport in the best of times, but the battle over whether to impeach President Dilma Rousseff is inflaming passions as never before.
